articles.description: High availability, fault tolerance and disaster recovery are important things to consider when designing a system.  These terms are sometimes used interchangeably by architects and developers. They are not, however, the same thing ‚Äì and understanding the differences can save you many headaches, as well as time and money.

articles.author: Rakesh KR
articles.description:
Flutter applications are written in the Dart programming language, and can connect to platform languages such as Java, Kotlin, Swift, and Objective-C. Also, thanks to ffi support, it is possible to interact with the C code directly . Flutter itself is built with C, C++, Dart, and Skia (a 2D rendering engine).
Flutter development is currently supported on Linux, Mac OS X, Chrome OS and Windows operating systems.
Flutter is developed and maintained by Google and will be the main development SDK for Fuchsia, the expected and upcoming new Operating System also by Google.
Four main components of Flutter:
A heavily optimised, mobile-first 2D rendering engine (with excellent support for text) for 60fps apps
A functional-reactive framework so you can build customised UIs
A rich set of libraries an‚Ä¶
articles.title: In One Minute : Flutter

articles.author: Sohini Pattanayak
articles.description:
Entando Application Composition Platform Version 7.1 is now available to support enterprises who are modernizing applications to accelerate development, reduce runtime costs, and streamline maintenance through the use of a composable application architecture.   Entando brings developer joy to the creation, curation, and composition of modular enterprise applications.   

Background: 
Even before the 21st century, enterprises have been advancing infrastructure and strategies to solve business problems.  From the development of web applications on-prem, to their subsequent move to the cloud, and now, modularization in the cloud, each move has accelerated development, lowered cost and streamlined maintenance.  
This new phase of modularity focused on decoupling (or breaking up) both the backe‚Ä¶
articles.title: Entando 7.1 Release Overview

articles.author: Luca Del Puppo
articles.description:
Hi folks,

today I'm going to speak about another cool VsCode Extension.
In many projects, I love using GitHub Actions as CI/CD tool, but switching between VsCode and the GitHub website is very boring and frustrating. So, one day I decided to google if there was a way to follow my actions directly in my best Editor, and some minutes later I found this fantastic extension: GitHub Actions. This extension and that seen in the previous article have changed my way of working, and now I'm almost free from the browser during my coding phase. I say almost because sometimes I have to check my email or scroll the Twitter wall to stay updated and get the last news üôÇ But let's see together what this extension is able to do üöÄ
As with any other extensions, the installation is a piece of cake, you have‚Ä¶
articles.title: Working with GitHub Actions from your best editor

articles.author: Bobur Umurzokov
articles.description:
There are many ways and technology options to consider when implementing an event-driven API. For example, we explored how to build event-driven APIs using these 3 well-known patterns: CQRS, API Gateway and Serverless  on the previous blog post. This post elaborates on building event-driven APIs by making use of Webhook and API Gateway, we understand the role of each in this solution. Firstly, let‚Äôs turn our attention to the initial problem statement without the webhook in place. 
Consuming applications expect to be informed of any change of state on a specific record or records. 
Examples:
Updating or adding customers in a CRM system triggers an event.
Currency exchange rates from a foreign exchange application informs users about currency change.
New post on a user's blog notifies subscr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Event-Driven APIs with Webhook and API Gateway

articles.author: Fatih Telis
articles.description:
Hello,
I'm Fatih, the creator of 10015.io. I've developed one of the most popular text to handwriting converters on web. It was a though development process as it has many difficult steps like conversion of html into images and also converting them into pdf files. 
One of the most requested feature of this tool was multiple page support. At first, it is not easy to figure out how to split text into multiple pages because the area of the text, line heights and fonts are all dynamic. After a long development process, I've added multipage support to text to handwriting converter on 10015.io.
Now, it automatically splits the text into multiple pages and you can download the image and PDF of each page separately or download all as a single PDF file. Here is how the output looks.

You can give it a try and comment about your thoughts about the new feature.
https://10015.io/tools/text-to-handwriting-converter
üëã
articles.title: Text to Handwriting Conversion of Long Texts into Single PDF File

The cool part is that we are not expected to upgrade all at once, as our pages structure will keep working.

This new change in routing enabled us to create more complex interfaces.

The primary page inside this folder can have the main structure of the page, while next to it, we can have a layout.js file for the actual layout of this set of components.
Besides these two files, we get some other excellent special files we can use:

What is Form Collection?


Form collection is used to retrieve input elements from the controller action method. Form collection class automatically receives the data form value in controller methods in the form of key/value pair. Key and value pairs are accessed using the key name and index value.
Here in this article, I will show you how to use form collection and how we can use form collection class.
Here I will create the view to enter data into a database table using the form collection class available in ASP.NET MVC.

Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî® Pip ÂçáÁ∫ß Python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ

Âõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊé•‰∏ãÊù•Â∞±ËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨Ê∑±ÂÖ•‰∫ÜËß£Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî®Ëøô‰∏™ÊûÅÂ•ΩÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ PipÔºåÊù•ÁÆ°ÁêÜ‰∏é Python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑÂÜÖÂÆπÂêß„ÄÇ

1„ÄÅÂàóÂá∫ËøáÊó∂ÁöÑ Python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ

Âú®ËÆ°ÂàíÊõ¥Êñ∞‰ªÄ‰πàËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ‰πãÂâçÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÂÖàË¶ÅÂàóÂá∫ÊúâÂì™‰∫õËøáÊó∂ÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÈÄâÊã©ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÊõ¥Êñ∞ÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Â§ßÂ§öÊï∞‰∫∫‰∏ç‰ºöÊÉ≥‰∏Ä‰∏ãÂ≠êÊõ¥Êñ∞Êï¥‰∏™ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂ∫ì„ÄÇ

Ë¶ÅÂàóÂá∫ËøáÊó∂ÁöÑ Python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºå‰Ω†Âè™ÈúÄÂ∞Ü¬†pip¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§‰∏é¬†list¬†ÈÄâÈ°π„ÄÅ--outdated¬†Ê†áÂøó‰∏ÄÂêå‰ΩøÁî®Âç≥ÂèØÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÊâÄÁ§∫Ôºö

3„ÄÅÂ∞ÜËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂçáÁ∫ßÂà∞ÁâπÂÆöÁöÑÁâàÊú¨

Ê≤°ÊúâÂøÖË¶ÅÊÄªÊòØ‰ΩøÁî®ËΩØ‰ª∂ÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Â∞ÜËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÂçáÁ∫ßÂà∞‰∏çÊòØÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑÊüê‰∏™ÁâπÂÆöÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÂèÇËÄÉÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§ËØ≠Ê≥ïÔºö

4„ÄÅ‰ΩøÁî® Pip ‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊÄßÂçáÁ∫ßÊâÄÊúâËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ

ËØ∑Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºöÊàë‰∏çÂª∫ËÆÆ‰Ω†‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊÄßÂçáÁ∫ßÊâÄ‰ª•ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ Python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑ‰æùËµñÈ°πÂ§™Â§çÊùÇ‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊÄßÁöÑÂçáÁ∫ßÊó†Ê≥ïÂ§ÑÁêÜÁõ∏‰∫í‰æùËµñÈ°π„ÄÇ

Ë¶Å‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊÄßÂçáÁ∫ßÊâÄÊúâ python ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§Ôºö

‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü¬†xargs„ÄÇÈ¶ñÂÖàÔºå‰ºöÂæóÂà∞ÊâÄÊúâÈúÄË¶ÅÊõ¥Êñ∞ÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂØπÊØè‰∏™ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÊâßË°å¬†pip3 install -U¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇ

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂºÄÊîæÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÔºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÁßëÂ≠¶Èô¢ PLCT ÂÆûÈ™åÂÆ§ÁöÑÂ∑•Á®ãÂ∏àÂíåËΩØ‰ª∂ÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÂú® 2020 Âπ¥ÂºÄÂßãÂ∞Ü Android 10 ÁßªÊ§çÂà∞ RISC-V Êû∂ÊûÑ‰∏ä„ÄÇÈòøÈáåÂ∑¥Â∑¥ÁöÑ‰∫ëËÆ°ÁÆóÈÉ®Èó®ÂíåÂπ≥Â§¥Âì•ËäØÁâáÂ≠êÂÖ¨Âè∏‰∏ÄËµ∑Âä™Âäõ‰øùÊåÅÂºÄÂèë‰∏éÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑÂÆâÂçìÁâàÊú¨ÂêåÊ≠•„ÄÇ

ÈÄöËøáÂ¢ûÂº∫ RISC-V ‰∏äÁöÑÂÆâÂçìÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÂü∫Êú¨ÂäüËÉΩÔºåÂú® 2021 Âπ¥ÔºåÈòøÈáå‰∫ëÁöÑ‰∏ìÂÆ∂‰ª¨‰ªòÂá∫‰∫ÜÂ∑®Â§ßÁöÑÂä™ÂäõÔºåÁßØÊûÅÊé®Âä®‰∫ÜËΩØ‰ª∂ÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÂèëÂ±ï„ÄÇ RISC-V on Android ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÈõÜ‰∏≠Âú® RISC-V Android Â∑•‰ΩúÁªÑÂíåËΩØ‰ª∂Â∫ì‰∏≠ËøõË°å„ÄÇ

git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØ Git ‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÂÆÉ‰πüÊòØ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂñúÊ¨¢‰ΩøÁî® Git ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ


git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ËÉΩÂ§üËÆ©‰Ω†‰∫ÜËß£Âà∞Êõ¥Â§öÂÖ≥‰∫éË¥°ÁåÆËÄÖ¬†Êèê‰∫§commit¬†ÁöÑËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®¬†git log¬†ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñπÂºèÊòØÊåâÊó•ÊúüÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï „ÄÇË¶ÅÊü•ÁúãÂú®ÊåáÂÆöÊó•ÊúüÊàñÊó•ÊúüËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑ Git Â≠òÂÇ®Â∫ì‰∏≠ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåËØ∑‰ΩøÁî®Â∏¶ÊúâÈÄâÈ°π¬†--since¬†Êàñ¬†--until¬†ÊàñËÄÖÂêåÊó∂‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ä‰∏§‰∏™ÈÄâÈ°πÁöÑ¬†git log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§„ÄÇ

È¶ñÂÖàÔºåËøõÂÖ•‰Ω†Ë¶ÅÊü•ÁúãÁöÑÂàÜÊîØÔºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåmain¬†ÂàÜÊîØÔºâÔºö

$ git checkout main


Êé•‰∏ãÊù•Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÊù•ÊòæÁ§∫ÂΩìÂâçÊó•ÊúüÔºàÂç≥‰ªäÂ§©ÔºâÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö

$ git log --oneline --since="yesterday"


‰ªÖÊòæÁ§∫Êüê‰∏ÄÁâπÂÆöÁî®Êà∑Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÁî®Êà∑¬†AgilÔºâÂú®‰ªäÂ§©ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö

$ git log --oneline --since="yesterday" --author="Agil"


ËøòÂèØ‰ª•ÊòæÁ§∫Âú®Êüê‰∏ÄÊó•ÊúüËåÉÂõ¥ÂÜÖÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÊòæÁ§∫Âú®‰ªªÊÑè‰∏§‰∏™Êó•Êúü‰πãÈó¥Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºå2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•Ëá≥ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 24 Êó•ÔºâÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö

$ git log --oneline --since="2022-04-22" --until="2022-04-24"


Âú®‰∏äÈù¢Ëøô‰∏™‰æãÂ≠ê‰∏≠Ôºå‰ºöËæìÂá∫ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•Ëá≥ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 24 Êó•ÊúüÈó¥Ôºå‰∏çÂåÖÊã¨ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•ÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩï„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂåÖÊã¨ 2022 Âπ¥ 4 Êúà 22 Êó•ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåËØ∑Â∞ÜÂëΩ‰ª§‰∏≠ÁöÑ¬†2022-04-22¬†ÊõøÊç¢‰∏∫¬†2022-04-21„ÄÇ

ËøêË°å‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåËÉΩÂ§üÊòæÁ§∫Êüê‰∏ÄÁâπÂÆöÁî®Êà∑Ôºà‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÁî®Êà∑¬†AgilÔºâÂú®‰∏§‰∏™ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÊó•Êúü‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºö

$ git log --oneline --since="2022-04-22" --until="2022-04-24" --author="Agil"


ÊÄªÁªì

Git ÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰ºòÁÇπÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ºòÁÇπÂ∞±ÊòØ Git ËÆ©‰Ω†ËÉΩÂ§üÊî∂ÈõÜ‰Ω†È°πÁõÆÁöÑÁõ∏ÂÖ≥Êï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇgit log¬†ÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑÊü•ÁúãÊèê‰∫§ËÆ∞ÂΩïÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºå‰πüÊòØ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂñúÊ¨¢‰ΩøÁî® Git ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†‰πã‰∏ÄÔºÅ

articles.description:
Ëøô‰∏™Â∏¶ÊúâËÑöÊú¨ÁöÑÂø´ÈÄüÊåáÂçóÊúâÂä©‰∫éÊ∏ÖÁêÜÊóßÁöÑ Snap ÁâàÊú¨Âπ∂ÈáäÊîæ Ubuntu Á≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇ


ÊàëÊ≠£Âú®‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑ Ubuntu ÊµãËØïÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÁöÑÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥‰∏çË∂≥„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊàëÈÄöËøá GNOME ÁöÑÁ£ÅÁõò‰ΩøÁî®ÂàÜÊûêÂô®ËøõË°åË∞ÉÊü•Ôºå‰ª•ÊâæÂá∫Âì™‰∏™ÂåÖÊ≠£Âú®Ê∂àËÄóÂÆùË¥µÁöÑ SSD Á©∫Èó¥„ÄÇÈô§‰∫ÜÈÄöÂ∏∏ÁöÑÁºìÂ≠òÂíå‰∏ªÁõÆÂΩïÔºå‰ª§ÊàëÊÉäËÆ∂ÁöÑÊòØÔºåÊàëÂèëÁé∞ Snap Âíå Flatpak Ê∂àËÄó‰∫ÜÂ§ßÈáèÁöÑÂ≠òÂÇ®Á©∫Èó¥„ÄÇ



Â∞ΩÁÆ°Â¶ÇÊ≠§ÔºåÊàëÂßãÁªàÂùöÊåÅ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËßÑÂàôÔºöÈô§ÈùûÂøÖË¶ÅÔºåÂê¶Âàô‰∏çË¶Å‰ΩøÁî® Snap Êàñ Flatpak„ÄÇËøô‰∏ªË¶ÅÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÁöÑÂÆâË£ÖÂ∞∫ÂØ∏ÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇÊàëÊõ¥ÂñúÊ¨¢ÂéüÁîü deb Âíå rpm ÂåÖ„ÄÇÂ§öÂπ¥Êù•ÔºåÊàëÂú®Ëøô‰∏™ÊµãËØïÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÂÆâË£ÖÂíåÁßªÈô§‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂÆöÊï∞ÈáèÁöÑ Snap ÂåÖ„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÂç∏ËΩΩÂêéËøòÊúâÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇSnap Âú®Á≥ªÁªü‰∏≠‰øùÁïô‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∫õÊÆãÁïôÊñá‰ª∂Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨Áî®Êà∑‰∏çÁü•ÈÅì„ÄÇ

ÊâÄ‰ª•ÊàëÊâìÂºÄ‰∫Ü Snap Êñá‰ª∂Â§π¬†/var/lib/snapd/snapsÔºåÂèëÁé∞ Snap ‰øùÁïô‰∫Ü‰ª•ÂâçÂÆâË£Ö/Âç∏ËΩΩÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑÊóßÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ

‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåÂú®‰∏ãÂõæ‰∏≠Ôºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ GNOME 3.28„ÄÅ3.34 Âíå Wine ÈÉΩË¢´Âà†Èô§‰∫Ü„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂÆÉ‰ª¨ËøòÂú®ÈÇ£Èáå„ÄÇÂèëÁîüËøôÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ Snap ÁöÑËÆæËÆ°ÔºåÂÆÉÂú®Ê≠£Á°ÆÂç∏ËΩΩÂêé‰øùÁïôÂ∑≤Âç∏ËΩΩËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ



ÊàñËÄÖÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÁªàÁ´Ø‰∏≠‰ΩøÁî®Ôºö

snap list --all




ÂØπ‰∫é‰øùÁïôÁöÑÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÈªòËÆ§ÂÄº‰∏∫ 3„ÄÇËøôÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄ Snap ‰ºö‰øùÁïôÊØè‰∏™ËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÁöÑ‰∏â‰∏™ÊóßÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Ê¥ªÂä®ÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÂØπÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥Ê≤°ÊúâÈôêÂà∂ÔºåËøôÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÁöÑ„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÊòØÂØπ‰∫éÊúçÂä°Âô®ÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÊÉÖÂÜµÔºåËøôÂæàÂÆπÊòìÈÅáÂà∞ÊàêÊú¨ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂÆÉ‰ºöÊ∂àËÄó‰Ω†ÁöÑÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÊòØÔºå‰Ω†ÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®‰ª•‰∏ãÂëΩ‰ª§ËΩªÊùæ‰øÆÊîπËÆ°Êï∞„ÄÇËØ•ÂÄºÂèØ‰ª•Âú® 2 Âà∞ 20 ‰πãÈó¥„ÄÇ

sudo snap set system refresh.retain=2


Ê∏ÖÁêÜ Snap ÁâàÊú¨

Âú® SuperUser ÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁØáÊñáÁ´†‰∏≠ÔºåCanonical ÁöÑÂâçÂ∑•Á®ãÁªèÁêÜ Popey¬†Êèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑËÑöÊú¨ÔºåÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•Ê∏ÖÁêÜÊóßÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑ Snaps Âπ∂‰øùÁïôÊúÄÊñ∞ÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ

ËøôÊòØÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÁî®Êù•Ê∏ÖÁêÜ Snap ÁöÑËÑöÊú¨„ÄÇ

#!/bin/bash
#Removes old revisions of snaps
#CLOSE ALL SNAPS BEFORE RUNNING THIS
set -eu
LANG=en_US.UTF-8 snap list --all | awk '/disabled/{print $1, $3}' |
while read snapname revision; do
    snap remove "$snapname" --revision="$revision"
done


Â∞Ü‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑËÑöÊú¨‰ª•¬†.sh¬†Êâ©Â±ïÂêç‰øùÂ≠òÂú®‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁõÆÂΩï‰∏≠Ôºà‰æãÂ¶Ç¬†clean_snap.shÔºâÔºåËµã‰∫àÂÆÉÂèØÊâßË°åÊùÉÈôêÂπ∂ËøêË°å„ÄÇ

chmod +x clean_snap.sh


ÂΩìÊàëËøêË°åËÑöÊú¨ÂêéÔºåÂÆÉÂáèÂ∞ë‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§öÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇËØ•ËÑöÊú¨ËøòÂ∞ÜÊòæÁ§∫Ë¶ÅÂà†Èô§ÁöÑÂåÖÁöÑÂêçÁß∞„ÄÇ





ÁªìÊùüËØ≠

ÂØπ‰∫é Snap ÁöÑËÆæËÆ°ÊïàÁéáÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÔºå‰∫∫‰ª¨ÊÄªÊòØ‰∫âËÆ∫‰∏ç‰ºë„ÄÇËÆ∏Â§ö‰∫∫ËØ¥ÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑËÆæËÆ°ÊòØÂùèÁöÑÔºåÊòØËáÉËÇøÁöÑÔºåÊòØÊ∂àËÄóÁ≥ªÁªüËµÑÊ∫êÁöÑ„ÄÇËøôÁßçËØ¥Ê≥ïÁöÑÊüê‰∫õÈÉ®ÂàÜÊòØÁúüÂÆûÁöÑÔºåÊàë‰∏ç‰ºöÂê¶ËÆ§ÂÆÉ„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÂÆûÊñΩÂíåÂä†Âº∫ÂæóÂΩìÔºåÊï¥‰∏™Ê≤ôÁõíÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÊ¶ÇÂøµÊòØÂæàÂ•ΩÁöÑ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊàëÁõ∏‰ø°Ôºå‰∏é Snap Áõ∏ÊØîÔºåFlatpak Â∑•‰ΩúÂÅöÂæóÊõ¥Â•Ω„ÄÇ

‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØËØ¥ÔºåÊàëÂ∏åÊúõËøôÂèØ‰ª•Â∏ÆÂä©‰Ω†Ê∏ÖÁêÜ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁ£ÅÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥„ÄÇÂ∞ΩÁÆ°ÂÆÉÂè™Âú® Ubuntu ‰∏≠ËøõË°å‰∫ÜÊµãËØïÔºå‰ΩÜÂÆÉÂ∫îËØ•ÈÄÇÁî®‰∫éÊâÄÊúâÊîØÊåÅ Snap ÁöÑ Linux ÂèëË°åÁâà„ÄÇ

Ê≠§Â§ñÔºåËØ∑Êü•ÁúãÊàë‰ª¨ÂÖ≥‰∫é¬†Â¶Ç‰ΩïÊ∏ÖÁêÜ Ubuntu¬†ÁöÑÊåáÂçó‰ª•ÂèäÂÖ∂‰ªñÊ≠•È™§„ÄÇ

ÊúÄÂêéÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†Ë¶ÅÊ∏ÖÁêÜ¬†Flatpak¬†Â∫îÁî®ÔºåËØ∑ÂèÇÈòÖ¬†ËøôÁØáÊåáÂçó„ÄÇ

articles.author: AmyJune Hineline
articles.description:
What stickers are on your laptop?
AmyJune Hineline
Tue, 11/08/2022 - 03:00

            
Having just switched work laptops last December, I realized how much I love applying stickers to my work machines. Sometimes the stickers are souvenirs from past events, others are from projects that I am passionate about, and some are just for fun!
Curious to know what others had on their laptops, I asked!
Accessibility advocate
  
Image by: 
(AmyJune Hineline, CC BY-SA 4.0)
Here is my work laptop (Can you tell my roots are in Drupal). My favorite decal is the Druplicon with the wheelchair... When Drupal 8 came out, we took the logo and blended it with the wheelchair because the agency I worked with focused on accessibility.

articles.author: Katie Edwards
articles.description:
What you actually need to know about open source to get started
Katie Edwards
Mon, 11/07/2022 - 03:00

            
So you want (or need) to figure out what "open source" really means. I'll cover the basics of open source, whether you're interested in contributing to a project or want to be in the loop at a new job where the term keeps getting thrown around.
Full disclosure: I am a person with little technical experience, working in the content-design fringes of a very technical open source environment. Given my background in marketing and communication, I felt like a fish out of water when I made this career switch. Git, data science, the ins and outs of software‚Ä¶ It was, and still is a year later, a lot to comprehend.
But that's why I'm writing this piece. I want to help make open source‚Ä¶
articles.title: What you actually need to know about open source to get started

articles.author: Sergio Mijatovic
articles.description:
Build your own SaaS on Linux with Vely
Sergio Mijatovic
Mon, 11/07/2022 - 03:00

            
Vely combines high performance and the low footprint of C with the ease of use and improved safety of languages like PHP. It's free and open source software, licensed under GPLv3 and LGPL 3 for libraries, so you can even build commercial software with it.
Using Vely for SaaS
You can use Vely to create a multitenant web application that you can run on the Internet as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). Each user has a completely separate data space from any other.
In this example web application, a user can sign up for a notebook service to create notes and then view and delete them. It demonstrates several technology integrations in just 310 lines of code across seven source files. The technologies incl‚Ä¶
articles.title: Build your own SaaS on Linux with Vely

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Fix scanned images with ImageMagick
Seth Kenlon
Sat, 11/05/2022 - 03:00

            
Years ago while rummaging through the contents of a shelf in a used bookstore, I happened upon a booklet titled "UNIX System Command Summary for Berkeley 4.2 & 4.3 BSD," published by¬†Specialized Systems Consultants. I bought it as a curiosity item because it was nearly 20 years old yet still largely applicable to modern Linux and BSD.
That amused me then and now. A booklet written in 1986 was still largely relevant in 2016, while books on the same shelf about a proprietary OS weren't worth the paper they were printed on. (Think about it: What technology do¬†you¬†think is going to survive a zombie apocalypse?) I've had the booklet on my own bookshelf for several years now, but it occurred to me that it's pro‚Ä¶
articles.title: Fix scanned images with ImageMagick

How to iterate over tables in Lua
Seth Kenlon
Fri, 11/04/2022 - 03:00

            
In the Lua programming language, an array is called a table. A table is used in Lua to store data. If you're storing a lot of data in a structured way, it's useful to know your options for retrieving that data when you need it.

articles.author: Seth Kenlon
articles.description:
Is Lua worth learning?
Seth Kenlon
Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00

            
Lua is a scripting language used for procedural programming, functional programming, and even object-oriented programming. It uses a C-like syntax, but is dynamically typed, features automatic memory management and garbage collection, and runs by interpreting bytecode with a register-based virtual machine. This makes it a great language for beginners, but also a powerful tool for experienced programmers.
Lua has been somewhat eclipsed from the public view by languages like Python and JavaScript, but Lua has several advantages that make it popular in some major software projects. Lua is easily embedded within other languages, meaning that you can include Lua files in the code base of something written in (for instance)‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is Lua worth learning?

articles.author: Phil Shapiro
articles.description:
How open source weaves connections between countries
Phil Shapiro
Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00

            
Long ago, when I was a tech administrator for Arlington Public Schools, I received an unexpected email saying, "Our school in India loves your children's stories, so we've printed them all out in braille."
Apparently, the school had found my collection of children's stories on the web. I spent a moment visualizing those students so far away, enjoying my stories on those printed pages of braille. The email's sender might not have realized how meaningful their email was to me, but it's stayed with me for two decades.
Tell collaborative stories with open source
That experience got me thinking about how technology can weave new connections between people in different countries. While surfing‚Ä¶
articles.title: How open source weaves connections between countries

articles.author: Florian Robert
articles.description:
Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology
Florian Robert
Wed, 11/02/2022 - 03:00

            
Advertisers sell the myth of the "Smart Home" as a magical world where you automate everything with ease to simplify your life and free your mind of trivial tasks. It looks great on paper and TV, but so far, it's mainly been a battle of technologies and manufacturers.
Suppose you want to add a presence sensor from manufacturer A to your existing hub from manufacturer B so you can switch ON your light from manufacturer B. Or perhaps you want to switch OFF your air conditioner when your door is open, but the door sensor is not from the air conditioning manufacturer. Will it work?
There's a significant chance that the devices you want to link to one another don't talk the same ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology

articles.author: Nitish Tiwari
articles.description:
Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform
Nitish Tiwari
Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00

            
Log data is one of the fastest-growing segments across data storage. It's also one of the most complicated spaces. There are several products and solutions with overlapping use cases and confusing marketing.
This article looks at Parseable, a log storage and observability platform. Parseable is geared towards a better user experience, with an easy-to-deploy and use interface and a simple, cloud-native architecture. I'll also show how to set up Parseable with FluentBit to store logs.

More on Microservices

Free eBook: Microservices vs. service-oriented architecture
Free online course: Developi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform

articles.author: Paul
articles.description:
Transfer files and folders from Windows to Linux with WinSCP
Paul
Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00

            
Sometimes you need to transfer files over a network. There are lots of file sharing services out there, but most require that you send your file to the Internet. This seems like a long way to go (not to mention the privacy concerns) when two computers are right beside each other, or at least in the same building. The open source WinSCP utility makes it quick and easy to transfer a file or a folder of files over the network from your Windows computer to your Linux computer.

Now a well-known leaker says the ‚Äúunlaunched‚Äù GPU will return as the RTX 4070 Ti in January, as Nvidia attempts to fix the confusing naming around two RTX 4080 cards that had totally different specs.

For when your boss really wants to be on the big screen. | Image: The Verge
    

  
File this one under collaborations we didn‚Äôt see coming: AMC is working with Zoom to turn some of its movie theaters into massive videoconferencing spaces for 75 to 150 people for when you really need your meeting to leave an impact. AMC will even provide ‚Äúfood and beverage offerings, possible movie viewings, and concierge-style personalized handling of meeting needs,‚Äù though for an additional cost, of course.
The theater chain says that when companies are planning a gathering, they can book theaters across the country online, so their employees can have a similar experience on the call. Vjeran Pavic / The Verge
    

  
I can‚Äôt change my screen name on Twitter. I can change my bio. But not my screen name. So although I was helpfully trying to describe myself as ‚ÄúElizabeth Lopatto (parody)‚Äù that simply wasn‚Äôt possible.
TFW Twitter is broken
  
Now I hear Elon Musk fired about 50 percent of Twitter employees (though apparently he‚Äôs trying to hire some of them back). I also hear that lots of people have been changing their screen names to ‚ÄúElon Musk‚Äù in order to get excommunicated. According to David Sacks, an investor in Musk‚Äôs deal to take Twitter private, ‚ÄúTwitter‚Äôs longstanding policy is that the account name must indicate a parody account.‚Äù Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt comply.

Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
T-Mobile is reportedly considering building a multibillion-dollar fiber network that it would use to provide home internet service, according to Bloomberg. While the company started testing fiber internet last year, its main home-focused offering connects with 5G instead of other wired infrastructure like DSL or cable.
Bloomberg reports that the carrier has been working with Citigroup to find financial partners for a potential $4 billion joint venture or ‚Äúcommercial partnership.‚Äù It seems like early days for the plan, and it‚Äôs possible nothing will come of it, but it still feels like a significant step for the wireless carrier, which has traditionally used and managed a very different kind of infrastructure.

articles.title: T-Mobile may be looking to spend big on fiber home internet

articles.description:
an easy-to-use platform that allows you to start a Bug Bounty program for your web and mobile applications in just a few clicks.

We‚Äôve started BountyPage because we got frustrated with the way bug bounty programs are setup today - ‚ùå expensive and strenuous! Traditionally these programs were designed only for big corporations that can afford the crazy high costs. Our mission is driven by the belief that crowdsource security should be  ‚úÖ open and accessible to anyone - no matter their size and type.

On average, a standard bug bounty program launch would cost you:
- Tens of thousands of dollars in service fees alone¬†üíµ
- 1-3 months of preparation time¬†‚è∞
- Endless calls and emails back and forth with the accounts team¬†‚ôæÔ∏è 

Keeping it super simple, BountyPage offers:
‚úÖ Beautiful and simple to use, hosted bug bounty form.
‚úÖ Intuitive inbox-like experience where you can triage issues with your team and establish communication with bug bounty hunters.
‚úÖ The ability to create invite-only programs.
‚úÖ Tools to understand the types of issues with reference links and descriptions.
‚úÖ A holistic view of all researchers in your program.
‚úÖ Custom subdomains (https://demo.bountypage.com).
‚úÖ Invite team members to triage vulnerabilities together.

Oh, and did I mention? It‚Äôs completely üåü FREE to get started. On average you can launch your first program in just a couple of minutes and share a custom link from your own website.ü§©

Please let us know what you think! We very much appreciate any comments and suggestions. We‚Äôre constantly improving BountyPage and have big plans for feature releases in the next couple of months and your input can have a huge impact on the product development. üí¨ üíô

articles.description:
So how is the sales process in the future? How can we solve this problem with technology?
Following our vision, Data intelligence and AI technologies will become more and more efficient and within few years, there will be no separation between the sales process, applications, data and analytics. All four parts will merge into a single concept: artificial intelligence for sales.

So this is Ovy for Sales: the first step towards the future of a new digital sales process. This is the first italian platform that starts to identify companies and key people on B2B websites, understand the buying intent, engage them in warm and customized conversations with the goal to convert them and schedule sales meetings. 

Ovy can be integrated directly with Zapier and CRMs. Ovy for Sales is based on our proprietary Artificial Intelligence technology combined with data intelligence. The result is incredible.

So, with Ovy you can:
üîç Discover companies behind anonymous visits, making an efficient prospecting.
üí¨ Engage with real conversations with prospects in real time from anywhere.
üìÖ  Generate more high-value opportunities and meetings
üîó  Seamlessly integrate your sales and marketing tools.

The product is already available; you can test it with a 14 days-free trial. Until now the results have been astonishing and we can‚Äôt wait to see how our users will use it!

We constantly improve our products based on what our customers need, so please share your feedback, comments, questions! üôè

- Antonio
